input: Write a polite sonnet about friendship.
output:
In gentle ties where hearts doth softly cling,
As roses in sweet spring's tender breath they bloom;
With fellowship that ever gently lings,
How sweeter speech than this I would bestow.
For thou hast come, within my bosom oft,
And all thy visits, like a rose's light,
A comfort to the darkened spirit take.
Yet, though with thee I do amicably join,
I must avow, within this realm of time,
Some task constrains me from thy festal train.

Thou art not in the courtly world alone,
But dost walk through its midst as one of them;
And so my words to friendship are a boon,
To praise the bonds that make our lives seem less dim.
May all our days be filled with joy and cheer,
And may we ne'er part from this sweet care.
